topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: KVM + ESX Deployment Architecture Reference

body.p: This page introduces deployment and network architectures of the KVM + ESX deployment of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. This deployment supports the integration of VMware ESX storage into HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: Regions
section.p: For installation and maintenance, HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade consists of two logical or conceptual regions: Non-KVM and KVM. You will see these terms used in the installation process. The Deployment Architecture diagram shows an illustration of these two zones.

The Non-KVM region contains the HPE Helion Lifecycle Management (HLM), to deploy and maintain HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade; and HPE Helion OpenStack, a commercial-grade distribution of OpenStack. The ESX and DCN components and servers also reside in the non-KVM zone.

The KVM region is the heart of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. The KVM region consists of a software platform, providing ultra-reliability and exceptional performance efficiencies for telecommunications networks.

body.section:
HPE Distributed Cloud Networking Components
The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade KVM + ESX deployment uses HPE Distributed Cloud Networking to provide virtual networking within the cloud.
DCN must be deployed before starting the cloud deployment. Please refer to DCN documentation for details. The main components in the HP DCN solution are: Virtualized Services Directory (VSD) and Virtualized Services Directory Architect (VSD-A), Virtualized Services Controller (VSC) and Virtual Routing and Switching (VRS).
HPE Virtualized Service Directory (VSD) - The VSD is a policy engine for managing users, compute resources and network resources, that is located on a server outside of the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud.
HPE Networks Virtualized Services Directory Architect (VSD Architect). The VSD Architect is a browser-based interface for management tasks on the VSD.
HPE Virtual Services Controller (VSC): The VSC is a virtual machine application running all the control plane tasks, maintaining a full view of per-tenant network and service topologies. The VSC should be installed on the KVM host system within the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud.
HPE Distributed Virtual Routing and Switching (VRS): The HPE VRS is the software agent that runs in each Hypervisor (HV). The HPE VRS component is an enhanced Open vSwitch (OVS) implementation that constitutes the network forwarding plane.
During the installation, you will be interacting with DCN. You should be familiar with the major DCN components, including how to access the various systems, IP addresses, and user credentials.
